question: According to the text, what kind of nature did Jake have? A) Sweet B) Angry C) Lazy D) Proud
Where did Jake's paper airplane land during the contest? A) In a tree B) On the roof C) In a trash can D) Under a desk
How old did Jake turn on his birthday? A) Fifteen B) Sixteen C) Seventeen D) Eighteen
How did Jake feel as he walked home after school? A) Excited B) Happy C) Angry D) Disappointed
The article mentions the airplane flew smoothly like what animal? A) A snake B) A bird C) A fish D) A cat
What was Jake's total score in the airplane contest? A) 40 points B) 80 points C) 17 points D) 100 points
Jake told his friends that failure is: A) The worst thing B) Something to hide C) An important part of life D) Not allowed at school
"There was nobody about." In this context, "about" means: A) Concerning B) Approximately C) Almost D) Nearby
What does Jake think is "more important" than current failure? A) Learning from the past B) Winning the next round C) Having a big party D) Being the best student
What did Jake put on before heading home in the late evening? A) A hat B) A coat C) A scarf D) A bag
What was waiting for Jake at home? A) A school project B) A new snake C) A party D) A pile of paper
"On the table, there were many dishes." A table is a piece of: A) Clothing B) School work C) Paper D) Furniture
Which word describes Jake's willingness to keep trying? A) Continue B) Part C) Stop D) Rule
Jake is described as a kind-hearted: A) Student B) Person C) Teacher D) Friend
Where did Jake place his body to pick up his fallen airplane? A) On his elbows B) On his back C) On his knees D) On his head
"Though he knew he could not control everything..." "Though" means: A) Because B) If C) Since D) Although
The text states Jake's final throw was "filled with power." This implies: A) Jake used a lot of force B) The plane had a motor C) The plane was very large D) It was a magic plane
Jake's classmates wanted to check "whether" he was okay. "Whether" means: A) That B) If C) Why D) When
Jake said failure is "not the worst." "Worst" is the opposite of: A) Bad B) Better C) Best D) Good
Jake was "known among his friends." "Among" means: A) Outside of B) Far from C) Behind D) In the middle of
Where was John walking with his granddaughter? A) Along the shore B) In a forest C) At a library D) On a mountain
At what time of day did John enjoy the quiet of the beach? A) In the morning B) In the evening C) At noon D) At midnight
The peace and quiet of the shore gave John: A) A headache B) Money C) Rest D) A job
John was famous locally for giving: A) Gifts B) Directions C) Money D) Speeches
Who was building a sandcastle with a fat little boy? A) John’s grandchild B) John’s son C) A teacher D) An eagle
What kind of bird was soaring high in the sky? A) A duck B) An eagle C) A chicken D) A snake
Where did the children have happy smiles? A) In their pockets B) On their hands C) On their faces D) In the sea
What color was the ticket John had in his pocket? A) Silver B) White C) Black D) Gold
John thought it was "likely" he would talk about the beach. "Likely" means: A) Probable B) Impossible C) Scary D) Strange
John wanted a speech that children could: A) Forget B) Understand C) Write D) Ignore
If the speech did not answer questions, it would: A) Be great B) Be loud C) Mean nothing D) Be gold
"After a while, it was getting dark." "While" refers to: A) A reason B) A person C) A place D) A period of time
The movement of waves is compared to: A) The ups and downs of life B) Building sandcastles C) Eating dinner D) Walking home
What does "footing the bill" mean in the text? A) Stepping on paper B) Paying the cost C) Kicking a ball D) Running away
John's speech had to "answer" the kids' questions. "Answer" means: A) Ask B) Ignore C) Reply to D) Hide from
What kind of boy was building the sandcastle? A) A tall boy B) A thin boy C) A fast boy D) A fat boy
John was feeling "fine" because of the beautiful scene. "Fine" means: A) Very good B) Angry C) Sick D) Worried
What was the sand's color compared to? A) Gold B) Salt C) Blue D) Dark
John thought about the "purpose" of life. "Purpose" means: A) Cost B) Name C) Reason or aim D) Height
What did the shore provide John besides rest? A) Sand B) Water C) Fish D) Quiet
What did the Smith family all love to do? A) Cook B) Swim C) Paint D) Run
What kind of animal was in the Smith family? A) A dog B) A kitty C) A bird D) A snake
The kitty would follow a family member whenever there was: A) Silence B) Rain C) Movement D) Sleep
What did the kitty do with its tail when excited? A) Hid it B) Bit it C) Lost it D) Wagged it
When did the family receive a note about the market? A) The day before B) Last year C) That morning D) Next week
How did the neighbors invite the Smith family? A) By phone B) By note C) By radio D) By email
What flavor were the family's special cookies? A) Chocolate B) Salt C) Corn D) Apple
What drink goes well with the cookies and cakes? A) Milk B) Water C) Juice D) Tea
The sunrise meant the weather would be good. "Rise" refers to: A) Moving upward B) Moving down C) Disappearing D) Getting cold
The text says the sunrise meant the _____ would be good. A) Food B) Weather C) Market D) Party
By 10am, there was a sudden "raise" in people. In this context, "raise" means: A) A salary increase B) A lift C) An increase in number D) A mountain
Some people were "lost for words" because: A) They forgot how to speak B) They were angry C) It was too loud D) The food was so good
What kind of games were going on outdoors? A) Sport B) Video C) Board D) Card
What did Mr. Smith look at to decide to clear up? A) The sun B) His watch C) The kitty D) The table
"All the family members were helping." "All" means: A) Half B) None C) Every one D) Some
Where did the family gather every night? A) In the garden B) At the school C) In the park D) Around the dinner table
The family would save recipes that were a big: A) Hit B) Error C) Secret D) Mistake
"The kitty would tail a family member." Here, "tail" means: A) To catch B) To follow C) To bite D) To bark
Seeing the kitty following them put what on the family's faces? A) Salt B) Movement C) Smiles D) Water
At the end of the day, Mr. Smith decided to: A) Bake more B) Go to the park C) Sleep D) Clear up the stall
What was Jack's job? A) Cab driver B) Teacher C) Nurse D) Artist
Jack "nursed" Lily by himself. This means he: A) Worked at a hospital B) Cared for and raised her C) Taught her piano D) Drove her in a cab
Who was Jack's daughter? A) Rose B) Mary C) Lily D) Anna
What meal did Jack and Lily have before spending time together? A) Breakfast B) Lunch C) Snack D) Supper
What would Jack help Lily write in the evenings? A) Sentences B) Charts C) Books D) Music
What did Jack and Lily draw together? A) Pictures B) Charts C) Sentences D) Houses
On what day of the week did Jack not work? A) Friday B) Saturday C) Sunday D) Monday
Lily went to painting classes held ______. A) In the kitchen B) At the library C) In the park D) Outside
Lily had a gift in arts and never tired of: A) Practice B) Work C) Sleeping D) Driving
What was the paper Lily handed to Jack? A) A school report B) A pass to a contest C) A drawing D) A grocery list
The contest Lily entered was for the whole: A) City B) Town C) State D) Country
Jack let Lily ______ for herself if she wanted to join. A) Paint B) Talk C) Write D) Decide
What was the lowest prize in Lily's age group? A) One thousand dollars B) One hundred dollars C) Ten dollars D) Fifty dollars
What word from the song title "Set ____ to the rain" did Lily play? A) Water B) Fire C) Light D) Snow
The audience went "clean out" of the room. "Clean" means: A) Washing B) Tidily C) Completely D) Slowly
"Have I troubled you?" "Trouble" in this context means: A) Helped B) Bothered or caused difficulty C) Taught D) Surprised
What did Jack do to Lily's face to comfort her? A) Rubbed it gently B) Washed it C) Painted it D) Kissed it
Jack called Lily his young: A) Daughter B) Lady C) Queen D) Child
What did Jack give Lily on her head? A) A hat B) A rub C) A kiss D) A pat
What weather condition did Jack work in besides rain? A) Wind B) Heat C) Fog D) Snow
The narrator spent _____ time with his brother than usual. A) Less B) More C) Most D) All
In which month did the story take place? A) November B) December C) January D) April
The café was located _____ the street. A) Under B) Behind C) Across D) Inside
What did the brother do after he "sighted" an open spot? A) Ran away B) Bought a tea C) Walked home D) Parked the car
What did the brother do with the car along the street? A) Parked it B) Sold it C) Cleaned it D) Fixed it
What did the waiter do for them after 20 minutes? A) Brought fish B) Set up a table C) Took a report D) Drank tea
The narrator did not drink coffee, _____ did his brother. A) And B) But C) Nor D) So
What kind of burger did the brother order? A) Chicken B) Beef C) Cheese D) Fish
The brother's business trips were to what kind of countries? A) Foreign B) Small C) Cold D) Nearby
What did the brothers do regarding the dying flowers? A) Ignored them B) Reported it C) Picked them D) Watered them
What skill did they learn from the gardener? A) Driving B) Cooking C) Gardening D) Painting
How is the garden described in the text? A) Small B) Dark C) Silly D) Huge
How did they describe spending quality time together? A) Important B) Boring C) Easy D) Foreign
The narrator said it was _____ to think his brother didn't care. A) Smart B) Silly C) Fine D) Dark
The narrator had _____ his brother for someone who didn't care. A) Reported B) Drank C) Mistaken D) Put
What did they do with the holiday decorations? A) Threw them B) Sold them C) Bought them D) Put them up
Time with the brother was better _____ usual. A) Than B) Nor C) Across D) Put
Where did the brother park the car? A) In a garage B) On the street C) In the garden D) At a school
How was the morning described? A) Bright B) Dark C) Warm D) Golden
What did the narrator order to eat/drink? A) Tea and burger B) Water and fish C) Coffee and cake D) Hot chocolate and sandwich

unit: Unit 41: A Fun Day by the Lake
question: The brothers realized they grew in _____ and had less time together. A) Age B) Height C) Power D) Luck
What kind of lake did they visit? A) Private B) Public C) Secret D) Small
How is the lake's environment described? A) Hot B) Dark C) Lake D) Beautiful
What did they pack for the trip besides drinks? A) Games B) Toys C) Books D) Food
Where did they set up their picnic? A) In the open B) In a car C) In a tent D) Under a bridge
What kind of sandwiches did they enjoy? A) Fish B) Chicken C) Apple D) Beef
Playing games with the brother was: A) Boring B) Silly C) Fun D) Difficult
What did they do to the ground to find something interesting? A) Painted it B) Shook it C) Counted it D) Dug a hole
What did they find on the ground after shaking the tree? A) Leaf B) Apple C) Bird D) Food
What did they do to the tree to try to get apples? A) Shook it B) Cut it C) Painted it D) Dug it
What fruit were they hoping would fall from the tree? A) Apple B) Orange C) Nut D) Berry
How many swans did they count on the lake? A) Five B) Six C) Seven D) Eight
Which swan seemed to be aging? A) The front one B) The back one C) The middle one D) The last one
"The front one seemed to be aging." "Seemed" means: A) Known B) Appeared C) Hoped D) Asked
What "powered" the boat they rode? A) Gas B) Wind C) Solar power D) Electricity
"The truth soon outed." "Outed" in this context means: A) Left B) Became known C) Went dark D) Failed
"There are a _____ of people at the concert." (Word List example). A) Lot B) View C) Power D) Age
What did they have from the top of the spot? A) Food B) View C) Apple D) Seven
How did they "milk" the time together in the evening? A) Drank milk B) Played video games C) Slept early D) Did homework
What did the narrator have to "deal" with at the end? A) A boat B) A swan C) A project D) A mistake
Anna loved to record the _____ beauty of nature. A) True B) Fake C) Low D) Dear
What was Anna's primary tool for her hobby? A) Fork B) Camera C) Movie D) Paint
In which month did Anna go on her adventure? A) October B) December C) November D) April
Where did Anna carry her backpack? A) Head B) Knees C) Hands D) Shoulders
Anna felt like she was in a _____ while walking. A) Movie B) Mountain C) Pond D) Study
Anna lived near the: A) Sea B) Mountain C) City D) Forest
What did Anna see at the small pond? A) Fish B) Snakes C) Ducks D) Swans
How were the ducks swimming? A) In a circle B) In a line C) Under water D) Randomly
Anna thought about the beauty within her: A) Reach B) Pocket C) Camera D) Mind
Anna wondered if _____ created the beautiful earth. A) Man B) God C) Tom D) Nature
What tool did Anna use to eat her sandwich? A) Spoon B) Knife C) Fork D) Hands
Tom, the artist, had run out of: A) Film B) Camera C) Food D) Paint
Anna told Tom to _____ her for the photos. A) Pay B) Thank C) Shout D) Shut
Anna got her best photos into: A) Movies B) Paint C) Print D) Size
Anna _____ the photos to fit the frames. A) Painted B) Once C) Sized D) Past
What did Anna do with the door of her study before bed? A) Painted it B) Shut it C) Sized it D) Opened it
Anna planned to give adventuring another: A) Go B) Guess C) God D) Reach
Anna "secretly took a _____" that she would adventure soon. A) Paint B) Guess C) Shout D) Dear
How was the day described? A) Quite pleasant B) Dark C) Low D) True
Anna's friend Tom was her "_____ friend." A) True B) Dear C) Low D) Past
What sport was John playing on Saturday? A) Basketball B) Baseball C) Soccer D) Tennis
Why was it difficult for John to keep up with young players? A) He was rich B) He had a slow pace C) He was in the army D) He was happy
John hoped the young ones would not _____ him from playing. A) Help B) Visit C) Bar D) Police
What was about to happen to a part of the basket? A) Rise B) Fall C) Reach D) Lay
The basket was fixed _____ better than before. A) Far B) Near C) Often D) Slow
John had _____ experiences in fixing things. A) Rich B) Poor C) Difficult D) Slow
John decided he would _____ the court more often. A) Visit B) Reach C) Police D) Fall
John wanted to avoid dangerous _____. A) Stone B) Matters C) Tools D) Miles
John went for a good _____ after fixing the hoop. A) Feed B) Reach C) Mile D) Pocket
John's favorite _____ was a few miles away. A) Army B) Bar C) Sky D) Tool
John walked along what kind of road? A) Dirt B) Grass C) Stone-paved D) Sand
How was the sky described? A) Dark B) Cloudy C) Clear D) Black
John remembered his time in the: A) Bar B) Army C) Court D) Pocket
John _____ into his pocket for his phone. A) Fell B) Reached C) Visited D) Laid
Where did John reach to find his phone? A) Bar B) Army C) Pocket D) Sky
How did John get back to his car? A) He walked B) He ran C) He biked D) He took a taxicab
How often did John go to the court to relax? A) Often B) Rarely C) Never D) Once
John decided to _____ the neighborhood court. A) Bar B) Visit C) Slow D) Fall
Why was the match sometimes hard for John? A) It was slow B) It was far C) It was difficult D) It was rich
"Laying the tools back..." "Lay" means to: A) Take B) Place or put C) Break D) Buy

unit: Unit 44: A Day at the Beach
question: Who did Laura take to the beach? A) Her granddaughter B) Her aunt C) Her lady D) Her chief
What kind of cookies did they pack? A) Salt B) Cocoa and sugar C) Apple D) Corn
Where did they spend the day? A) The garden B) The army C) The beach D) The museum
Laura and Emma found a spot near the _____ of the water. A) Position B) Center C) Middle D) Edge
From their _____, they could view the sea. A) Position B) Beach C) Star D) Bone
They enjoyed the _____ of the beach. A) Money B) Beauty C) Cut D) Airmail
It was "very _____" that the day would be memorable. A) Bone B) Beauty C) Likely D) Light
How tall was the starfish Emma found? A) 10 inches B) 1 inch C) 17 inches D) 5 inches
Laura told Emma things so she could: A) Learn B) Bone C) Play D) Cut
Emma learned that starfish do not have: A) Stars B) Bones C) Feet D) Arms
Emma compared the starfish to a _____ in the sky. A) Light B) Moon C) Star D) Cloud
Emma _____ similar seashells together. A) Learn B) Likely C) Both D) Paired
How would Emma send her artwork to her dad? A) Airmail B) Taxicab C) Boat D) Bus
Emma's dad worked in the _____. A) Garden B) Police C) Museum D) Army
The artwork would cost Emma only a little: A) Time B) Beauty C) Money D) Likely
Emma felt love "_____" in her heart for her dad. A) Learn B) Beauty C) Bone D) Seeding
Emma had a small _____ on her left foot. A) Cut B) Star C) Bone D) Inch
Emma went off to _____ in the sand. A) Work B) Play C) Seed D) Bone
What color was the sea? A) Dark B) Light blue C) Black D) Gold
Laura and Emma _____ enjoyed the day. A) Both B) Airmail C) Likely D) Play
How old did Sam turn today? A) Eighteen B) Seventeen C) Sixteen D) Twenty
Sam's trip to the museum was happening: A) Yesterday B) Today C) Tomorrow D) Sunday
Sam felt a _____ on his shirt from Lily. A) Cut B) Bone C) Pull D) Top
What item of clothing was Lily pulling? A) Coat B) Hat C) Pants D) Shirt
What exhibit did Lily want to see? A) Mummy B) Airplane C) Police D) Garden
Sam's family _____ the signs to find the exhibit. A) Shut B) Followed C) Took D) Fixed
Who was explaining history in a quiet corner? A) A teacher B) A chief C) A guide D) A father
Sam wanted to learn as much as: A) Easy B) Sweet C) High D) Possible
The aviation section was to the _____ of the mummies. A) Left B) Right C) Front D) South
Sam had dreamed of learning to: A) Paint B) Fly C) Cook D) Police
What did the family order at the café? A) Pizza B) Salad C) Soup D) Chicken
Sam's father joked about feeling: A) Strong B) Brave C) Happy D) Weak
Who was near the entrance of the museum? A) Policeman B) Mummy C) Artist D) Army
Who was talking to children about his job? A) A guide B) Police chief C) A writer D) Sam
The chief wanted to _____ kids about the police. A) Pull B) possible C) Teach D) Eighteen
The police help build a _____ society. A) Just B) Weak C) Today D) Down
What did Sam want to _____ at the bookstore? A) Get B) Teach C) Shirt D) Chief
Sam thanked his family for _____ to the museum. A) Fly B) Go C) Pull D) Get
Where was the mummy exhibit located? A) Bottom floor B) First floor C) Top floor D) Basement
Sam sat _____ for dinner that evening. A) Up B) Left C) Possible D) Down

unit: Unit 46: A Spring Day of Dreams
question: In which month does this story take place? A) April B) September C) October D) November
What sport was Sam practicing at the field? A) Football B) Baseball C) Soccer D) Basketball
Sam played in what part of the field? A) Front B) South C) Middle D) Low
Sam would _____ his teammates during the game. A) Help B) Picture C) Give D) Guide
What was Sam's friend Jake's profession? A) Barber B) Writer C) Teacher D) Officer
Jake offered to _____ Sam a fresh haircut. A) Teach B) Give C) State D) picture
Jake _____ of opening his own barbershop. A) Hoped B) Talked C) Dreamed D) Stated
What animal exhibit did Sam visit? A) Bird B) Lion C) Monkey D) Elephant
The animals at the zoo were in: A) Cages B) Houses C) Study D) Tables
Sam felt it was hard to _____ the elephants as happy. A) Help B) Picture C) Dream D) Give
Sam thought they should have "at _____" fresh air. A) Most B) All C) Least D) More
What was the little girl at the zoo holding? A) A ball B) A book C) A shirt D) A doll
Sam decided to _____ the lost little girl. A) Help B) Guide C) State D) Picture
Sam was described as: A) Slow B) Quick-thinking C) Silly D) Weak
Sam _____ the situation to the staff. A) Decided B) Heard C) Stated D) Called
Sam visited a museum with an exhibit by a famous: A) Barber B) Teacher C) Guide D) Writer
Sam _____ hours looking at the writer's pages. A) Spend B) Picture C) Give D) Dream
Sam always aimed _____. A) Low B) High C) Ahead D) Least
Sam knew there were more adventures _____. A) Past B) Today C) Ahead D) High
Sam felt good knowing he had made a difference and said: A) Possible B) Just C) Shirt D) Thank

unit: Unit 47: An Adventure with Aunt Jane
question: Who invited the narrator for an outing? A) Aunt B) Chief C) Lady D) Officer
Where did they grab sandwiches and juice? A) School B) Market C) Forest D) Hospital
In what direction did they head towards the coast? A) North B) West C) South D) East
What color was the sky compared to a place for goddesses? A) White B) Gold C) Black D) Blue
In what month did the adventure take place? A) September B) November C) April D) October
What did the wind do to the heat? A) Raised B) Cool C) Set D) Put
Aunt Jane said it was time to _____ some responsibility. A) Carry B) Take C) Shoulder D) Give
The narrator was thrilled because he had never been: A) Sighted B) Paid C) Hurt D) Trained
The narrator was the _____ at driving. A) Worst B) Best C) Most D) Fine
Aunt Jane said the narrator might get _____ by an officer. A) Hurt B) Fined C) Marry D) Level
Who might fine the narrator for poor driving? A) Aunt B) Goddess C) Officer D) Chief
"All along the _____, the boat wound its way." A) Table B) Course C) Level D) Market
"The boat _____ its way in the water." A) Wound B) South C) Course D) Round
How was the water's surface described? A) Paved B) Level C) Smooth D) Dark
The narrator was glad they caused no _____ to the boat. A) Fine B) Moment C) Hurt D) Round
Once they arrived, they _____ themselves in a tent. A) Sighted B) Folded C) Built D) Housed
Where did they put their tent between two giant trees? A) Center B) Edge C) Top D) Down
What item did they unpack besides blankets? A) Shirt B) Sheet C) Suit D) Sock
What kind of paths did the island have? A) Straight B) Forking C) Paved D) Dark
What did the narrator think was about to happen on the island? A) Rain B) A fight C) A fire D) Marry

unit: Unit 48: A Piece of Friendship Memory
question: In what month did this friendship memory happen? A) October B) April C) September D) December
On what day of the week did they go exploring? A) Sunday B) Friday C) Tuesday D) Saturday
Jake and the narrator were working _____ at school. A) Less B) Silly C) Hard D) Late
How did they "_____ away the time"? A) Walk B) Piece C) Saw D) While
They explored the forest for no: A) Cost B) Price C) Chance D) Time
"We ran a bit _____ because I had to oil my bike." A) Fast B) Late C) High D) Low
What did the narrator do to his bike before the trip? A) Saw B) Oil C) Wash D) Put
What tool did the narrator bring for fallen branches? A) Hammer B) Drill C) Axe D) Saw
How is the forest described in the text? A) Quiet B) Busy C) Dark D) Huge
What did they see flying through the trees? A) Bug B) Bird C) Leaf D) Snake
What activity did they do in the hidden pond? A) Fish B) Swim C) Dig D) Shook
What did the muddy grass do to their clothes? A) Clean B) Soil C) piece D) Worm
"We almost drifted off to _____." A) Sleep B) Walk C) Swim D) Piece
What word describes the thing worming in the soil? A) Common B) Strange C) Lucky D) Even
What was the bug doing in the soil? A) Flying B) Jumping C) Worming D) Sleeping
What was the harmless creature in the soil? A) Bird B) Bug C) Snake D) Duck
The loud noise gave them a: A) Scare B) Hit C) Chance D) Dream
They found an old garden open to the: A) School B) Public C) Army D) State
What subject did Jake want to teach? A) Math B) Science C) English D) History
They felt _____ to have such a close friendship. A) Silly B) Sad C) Weak D) Lucky

unit: Unit 49: A Day Along the River
question: What day of the week was the public holiday? A) Tuesday B) Friday C) Sunday D) Monday
Where did the group decide to spend the day? A) The beach B) The bank of the river C) The museum D) The park
They packed _____ food to last the whole day. A) Lack B) Some C) Enough D) All
Jane did the final _____ of the supplies. A) Report B) note C) chart D) check
What kind of jacket did Jane suggest they bring? A) Down B) Leather C) Denim D) Light
"We walked _____ the path to the river." A) Along B) Near C) Over D) Behind
The trees were _____ deep into the ground. A) Falling B) Rooted C) Standing D) Reaching
I found a perfect spot to _____ under a tree. A) Work B) Play C) Cook D) Rest
After _____ ourselves comfortably, we talked. A) Positioning B) Grouping C) Check D) lack
The friends told _____ while eating and drinking. A) Stories B) Jokes C) Reports D) Charts
The friends _____ up and played games. A) Paired B) Grouped C) Rooted D) Positioned
"We played... so long _____ we all felt tired." A) If B) But C) And D) That
What did the friends see covered in moss and plants? A) A boat B) A ship C) A table D) A car
They didn't catch much fish because of their _____ of skills. A) Power B) Lack C) Need D) Problem
The trip was a _____ for all of us. A) Problem B) Start C) Must D) Joke
The story says we should check before a decision to avoid: A) Drinking B) Down C) People D) Problem
Tommy brought a _____ of cards to the river. A) Joke B) Pack C) Deck D) Group
What was the activity they did on the riverbank? A) Fishing B) Drinking C) Running D) Swimming
They wanted to forget about all other _____ for a while. A) People B) Problems C) Ships D) Holidays
"We set out with a good _____." A) Rest B) Down C) Joke D) Start

unit: Unit 50: A Day at the Zoo
question: Which place did the friends visit? A) City B) Beach C) Mountain D) Shore
The narrator made it to the _____ of the basketball match. A) Start B) Final C) Middle D) Half
Just as the gate opened, what was starting to rise? A) The wind B) The clock C) The sun D) The moon
What animal greeted them with a loud crow? A) Duck B) Snake C) Bird D) Rooster
The visitors had to _____ for their turn. A) Wait B) Turn C) Miss D) Still
Where were the birds sitting? A) Beside the trees B) In the water C) On the rocks D) At the gate
The birds' bright feathers caught the visitors': A) Hands B) Minds C) Eyes D) Smiles
The reptile house was _____ with a rock path. A) Painted B) Built C) Covered D) Floored
The visitors waited to make sure the animals were: A) Okay B) Busy C) Loud D) piece
How long did they wait for the snakes? A) 1 hour B) 15 minutes C) 10 minutes D) 5 minutes
The monkeys were chewing _____ of leaves. A) Seeds B) Bones C) Pieces D) Tables
Beside the monkey enclosure was a beautiful: A) Shore B) Army C) Court D) Garden
The garden was filled with: A) Flower B) Salt C) Money D) Paper
While eating, the friends shared funny: A) Jokes B) Story C) Reports D) Charts
The friends discussed the _____ of wildlife conservation. A) Story B) Dream C) Question D) Answer
Each friend wanted to give _____ to wildlife. A) Food B) Money C) Time D) Help
The narrator says zoos are like a "double-edged ____." A) Edge B) Sword C) Tool D) Star
